lom:description.lom:string: "ESSE is a joint program between AOSS and the Department of Geological Sciences because of the interconnectivity between the areas of study. As an ESSE student, you'll begin to understand the interactions among all Earth system components while gaining in-depth knowledge in one of three concentrations: Climate Physics, Meteorology or Space Weather. As a College of Engineering student, with the required 128 credits, you'll earn a BSE in Earth System Science & Engineering."

lom:title.lom:string: Undergraduate Atmospheric, Oceanic and Space Sciences Curriculum - University of Michigan
